key_title: Key to the species of Stellaria

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Miller, C.H.; West, J.G.
source.title: Stellaria
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Miller, C.H.; West, J.G. (1996). Stellaria. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Internodes with single line of hairs between nodes
Internodes entirely glabrous to uniformly hairy, without line of hairs between nodes
Petals present; only lower leaves petiolate; sepals 4–6 mm long; stamens 3–5; seeds dark reddish-brown, more than 0.9 mm long
Petals absent; most leaves petiolate; sepals 2–4(–4.5) mm long; stamens 1–3; seeds yellowish to mid brown, rarely dark, less than 0.9 mm long
Flowers numerous in a much-branched inflorescence, usually a dichasium
Flowers solitary and axillary, or in a monochasium, sometimes interrupted
Plant with basal rosette of filiform leaves and scarious, linear to ovate stem leaves; capsule far exceeding sepals; petals reduced, less than half sepal length
Plant with leaves ovate to linear throughout, lacking a basal rosette; capsule equal to or shortly exceeding sepals; petals c. equal to or exceeding the sepals
Inflorescence leaves and sepals occasionally toothed or scabrous, but never ciliate; capsule valves slightly recurved at apex; seeds (0.7–)1.0–1.4(–2) mm long
Inflorescence leaves and some sepal-margins ciliate; capsule valves straight; seeds, 0.5–1 mm long
Petals obvious, slightly less than, equal to or much longer than sepals
Petals not obvious, if present then less than half length of sepals, less than 2 mm long
Leaves appearing petiolate, spathulate, ovate or elliptic, margins usually undulate
Leaves sessile, narrow-ovate, lanceolate to linear, margins flat
Leaves and sepals acute and pungent, rigid, margins often sparsely ciliate; stems densely to sparsely tomentose
Leaves and sepals obtuse to acute but never pungent or rigid, margins glabrous or scabrous, never ciliate; stems glabrous to scabrous
Fruiting pedicels absent or short, usually less than 1 mm; seeds 2–3 per capsule; capsule valves thickened and papillate
Fruiting pedicels 1–20 mm long; seeds 5–25 per capsule; capsule valves thin, semi-transparent, not papillate
Leaves all petiolate; sepal-apex obtuse; petals absent; stamens 1–3
Leaves mostly sessile; sepal-apex acute; petals 3–5, rarely absent, minute, often reduced to a single arm; stamens (2–)3–10
